pageContext.claim: “If we build a powerful and fully-designed see-through steel barrier on our southern border, the crime rate and drug problem in our country would be quickly and greatly reduced. Some say it could be cut in half.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's statement that a border wall would cut the nation's crime rate -- and "drug problem" -- in half is simply laughable. There is no evidence to suggest that is the case. Most undocumented immigrants do not cross the southern border, undocumented immigrants do not commit crimes at a rate higher than U.S. citizens and drugs flow through the border mostly through legal crossing points.
